description: From New Latin hemiplegia, from Ancient Greek ἡμιπλήξ (hēmiplḗx), also ἡμιπληγής (hēmiplēgḗs, “stricken on one side”), from ἡμι- (hēmi-, “half”) + πλήσσω (plḗssō, “to strike”).

entries.meaning: Total or partial inability to move one side of the body.
examples: I call the series Dubliners to betray the soul of that hemiplegia or paralysis which many consider a city.
